text: Hi. Is it possible to record custom properties when tracking a user event? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/enterprise_events/http_api> For example, logging the name or a similar parameter when the user creates an object on our site
I am getting the following error with the API and a Windows service. "The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel." The vb service is using Framework 4.0

Hey. I know this thread is super old, but i'm running into the same issue. I've tried some of the permission combinations outlined here, but I still cannot oauth to my own integration.

I'm only requesting the `contacts` scope.

My issue started happening early March and I haven't made any changes to my oauth flow.

Hi there, I’m working on an integration that will use the bulk import API and I’m trying to get more information about the `idColumnType` field in the import request JSON. I see a screenshot of some draft documentation that mentions this field here:

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/CRM-Imports-Endpoint/m-p/314350>

Is there a published version of the documentation of these fields anywhere I couldn’t find any?

Hey Sidney, I would recommend signing up to our developer changelog here: <http://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|developers.HubSpot.com/changelog>

We also take the changes listed there and post them out to the <#CEQQ9NFK2|releases-and-updates> channel here as well as the community developer forums here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Developer-Announcements/bd-p/developer-announcements>

That is my understanding. They give an application controlled by you, a third-party, the tools to use the HubSpot API for integrations and provide data for things like CRM cards. Apps can be installed into multiple HubSpot portals, so you can essential have a multi-tenant SaaS app that does whatever you want and has the power to update HubSpot data for your users. Bear in mind I have only created a single private app; I am not the expert here.

Hi everyone, I've created a "login with HubSpot" functionality for my web-app. For the oauth client id and secret, I created a HubSpot app. But while logging in, it says that the app is not reviewed by HubSpot. How do I go about the review? Is it same as the review for market place listing? I don't plan to list my app in HubSpot app marketplace as it's a simple "Login with HubSpot" funtionality

Hi,
I need to analyze the CRM engagements (activities) data and to do it, I need the history.
Nothing found here:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/get-all-engagements>
Any help on how to achieve this?
Also, for those APIs that supports "properties history", how to know WHO did the change? I didn't find this basic info.
Hi Lance - Ok - I feel confident that my understanding is not totally off base.  Confident enough to publish anyway and see what happens. Haha. Thanks again for your thoughts.
I don't think there's a workaround for this today, but I made a similar inquiry about it

To my knowledge, the only way to link a known contact's email address with their HUTK is to use the Form Submission API. However, this is creating problems on forms with a lot of submission events, like this Login Form example.

Is there another recommended approach to save a contact's UTK to their email address?
I answered my own question! The <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/identify_visitor|Identify a Visitor API>

Hey guys. I am searching contacts by Phone Number using the api (
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/search>?```
)
. It is saved in various format in my CRM.
So when I do the search if the format matches it returns otherwise it does not.

Does anybody know how to solve this ?

Thanks
